metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1572 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
mount.ecryptfs_private.c in eCryptfs-utils does not validate mount destination filesystem types, which allows local users to gain privileges by mounting over a nonstandard filesystem, as demonstrated by /proc/$pid.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1572` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ecryptfs-utils - 104-0ubuntu1.14.04.4
libecryptfs0 - 104-0ubuntu1.14.04.4
python-ecryptfs - 104-0ubuntu1.14.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ecryptfs-utils package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '104-0ubuntu1.14.04.4').
